alert.note: Alert for Logan; Morgan; Washington (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 3:44PM MDT until June 17 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River near Balzac affecting Morgan, Logan and Washington Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...South Platte River near Balzac. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, The river is out of its banks and into fields and meadows. At 10.0 feet, Agricultural land floods along the river near Sterling. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue to slowly fall to around 9.0 feet then rise to a crest of 9.4 feet tomorrow evening. The river should remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
